title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content: 13:15  thanks 13:16  i stand corrected: i want to but i cannot. ;) 13:17  you just said that the path inside the profile is not reliable. It can change and it seems to be different for LibreOffice so the best is to use an API but I couldn't find that API 13:17  ah, ok, let me do it 13:18  true enough. i was just trying to suggest a dirty hack which would allow to change it at least for OO.o installations... and if you figure out what it is for LibO, also for that one. still only very dirty hacking... 13:18  only other way i could imagine would be to provide a patch for OOo/LibO and hope they adapt it, given there really is no API at this time 13:19  sdumitriu1: seems like xpage=attachments isn't correct. For ex: http://myxwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Jeromewentzel?xpage=attachments 13:20  That's right 13:20  It should be viewer=attachments 13:21  ok... 13:21  jstoldt: maybe there is an API hidden somewhere. both questions. let's see if we get reply 13:25  let me join the channel too 13:29  has quit 13:30  has joined #xwiki 13:34  has joined #xwiki 13:49  has joined #xwiki 13:54 <+lucaa> guys, I have some cause it? 14:05 <+tmortagne> lucaa: what is your test trying to do when you get this issue ? 14:05 <+lucaa> wait, I will debug and let you know 14:05 <+lucaa> it's the dashboard test 14:06 <+lucaa> the one and only 14:06 <+tmortagne> lucaa: do I have a easy way to reproduce this ? 14:06 <+lucaa> https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/core/trunk/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-macros/xwiki-rendering-macro-dashboard/src/test/java/org/xwiki/rendering/RenderingTests.java 14:06 <+lucaa> I think just adding the xwiki-core as a dep to the project 14:06 <+lucaa> e.g. the dashboard 14:06 <+lucaa> dashboard macro 14:06 <+lucaa> and then try to run it 14:07 <+tmortagne> ok 14:07 <+tmortagne> will do 14:08 <+tmortagne> last time i had this issue was because I was playing with classloader but it's pretty specific to extension manager 14:12 <+tmortagne> lucaa: xwiki-core depends on dashboard macro already 14:12 <+lucaa> mmh... 14:12 <+lucaa> I see 14:12 <+tmortagne> maybe that's what makes maven classloader a bit lost 14:13 <+lucaa> but xwiki-core doesn't really depend on dashboard, it just needs to drag it in the distribution... 14:14 <+tmortagne> sure, xwiki-core is not the best example of clean maven project 14:14 <+tmortagne> you can move dashboard dependency from xwiki-core to web if you need to depends on core 14:14 <+lucaa> lemme try that, and see what happens 14:15 <+lucaa> it's gonna be odd because all other macros are in the core 14:16 <+tmortagne> sure but that's not the only solution, you could introduce a new component module for what needs to manipulate xwiki-core directly and use it in your macro like we usually do 14:17 <+lucaa> that's what I do 14:17 <+lucaa> but I get the same issue 14:17 <+lucaa> I got it when I put the dep directly 14:17 <+lucaa> and then I put my code that manipulates core in another module and made macro depend on that module 14:17 <+lucaa> and it does the same 14:19 <+tmortagne> you need a api module and an implementation module otherwise it's useless 14:19 <+tmortagne> macro depends on api module to not transitively depends on xwiki-core 14:20 <+lucaa> ah right 14:20 <+lucaa> but then it's a tiny little bit of overkill 14:22 <+tmortagne> depends of your use case 14:22 <+lucaa> I need skin extensions 14:22 <+tmortagne> it's just a matter of does this new module would make some sense for others 14:22 <+lucaa> it surely makes a lot of sense for other situations as well 14:23 <+lucaa> mmh. wait I have an idea... 14:23 <+lucaa> ah no it's not gonna work :( 14:24  has quit 14:24 <+lucaa> so, I still think it's a bit of overkill to have 2 different modules for skinx wrapper, but we could actually implement the skinx API in the core itself 14:26 <+tmortagne> yes 14:26 <+tmortagne> like we do for other things 14:26 <+tmortagne> or the plugin 14:26 <+tmortagne> since that's where this is really 14:27 <+lucaa> yes, I was thinking about the plugin actually 14:27 <+lucaa> I still need sergiu 14:27 <+lucaa> sergiu's agreement for that this very purpose, to provide components interface for the skinx 14:30 <+lucaa> I sent it to sergiu and I am waiting for some response... 14:30  nice textual format: http://www.methods.co.nz/asciidoc/ vote on the list for the implementation of skinx component API, as we've discussed on this channel with tmortagne 15:17 <+lucaa> sdumitriu: please answer 15:18 <@sdumitriu> K 15:31  has quit 15:45  has quit 15:45  has joined #xwiki 16:01  has joined #xwiki 16:01  has quit 16:09  has quit 16:10  Mmm, I can't seem to find the code anywhere anymore, how do I use velocity again to check if a in the AbstractBlock implementation? 16:12  ( vmassol, tmortagne ) 16:12  thanks sdu 16:14  lucaa1: getParameter too apparently 16:14  yes, both parameters APIs 16:14  everything related to parameters 16:15  I can't think of a good reason 16:16  has joined #xwiki 16:17  I'd say it's an error 16:17 <+tmortagne> probably 16:17  well or rather we didn't have a use case for it yet 16:18  +1 to make it part of the Block interface from me 16:18 <+tmortagne> both, if we had use case we would have seen it ;) 16:18  I think this is the third time I ask :D 16:18 <+tmortagne> lucaa1: don't remember that 16:19  so, I open an issue, does anybody else than me want to fix it 16:19  maybe I always picked christmas or some other holidays to ask about this 16:19  :) 16:19  because once was somewhere last week 16:20  no, it was a 24 dec 16:20  nice timing 16:20  When I do something like this: [[Software Producten.$doc.display("OpenDir\_SoftProd")]] to make a link to a page it displays the pagename if "OpenDir\_SoftProd" is empty 16:20  which is a bad day to ask that, I agree 16:20  is this a bug or am I doing something wrong? 16:21  Menso: don't use display it generates HTML 16:21  $doc.getValue("...") 16:22  anyone else handling the Block thing, or I should do it? 16:22  lucaa1: go ahead 16:23  (I have too many local changes in the rendering module to handle it right now) 16:23  vmassol: issue remains 16:23  Menso: you should test what you get 16:23  print it 16:23  vmassol: ok 16:26  getParameters, getParameter, setParameters, setParameter, right? 16:26  yep 16:26  vmassol: the problem seems to be when I put it in a link 16:26  lucaa1: make sure you refactor the javadoc too 16:27  for example, see https://wiki.noiv.nl/xwiki/bin/view/GemAppTest/Haarlem 16:27  to use {inheritdoc} and @see 16:27  yes, I'll handle that 16:27  and change the @since tags 16:27  ok thanks 16:27  is there any xwiki.org documentation i need to update also? :P 16:27  I need to change since tags? for what? for the interface? 16:27  getValue and Display below 'Functies:' use $doc.display and $doc.getValue and both show nothing correctly, below that I put [[Space.$doc.getValue("somevalue")]] and it shows the title of the page in the link instead of being empty 16:28  lucaa1: you're lucky this time, no, althoug there are always stuff to improve on xwiki.org ;) 16:28  @since for the interface 16:28  hmm... that's how since works? 16:28  we change it when we change a function? 16:28  no 16:28  you're creating new apis 16:28  yes, yes 16:29  but we change @since tag when I do that? 16:29  what does since mean? 16:29  you can leave existing @since in AbstractBlock 16:29  s/can/should/ 16:31  wait, we have since tags for each function 16:31  that's the since tag you mean, right? not the class since tag 16:32  yes method 16:32  I see      \* @since 1.7M2 for setParameters 16:32  yes, I will leave that in the impl 16:33  brb 16:37  has joined #xwiki 16:42  has joined #xwiki 16:42  sdumitriu, Pong 16:43 <@sdumitriu> Ping? 16:43  anyone any idea on my earlier question regarding links to empty values? 16:47  Menso: you make a link to 16:47  MySpace.$doc.display("something") 16:47  so when $doc.display("something") is empty, your link goes to 16:47  MySpace. 16:47  which means, resolved as a reference, the current page 16:47  what is the result that you expect? 16:50  That makes sense, I was hoping it would not show any link 16:50  now I need to check all the values if empty and if not display and otherwise not I suppose? :) 16:50 <@sdumitriu> You do write [[ 16:50 <@sdumitriu> You get a link when you do that 16:51  yes, but I don't understand why it shows the page title of the current page 16:51  I think even [[]] displays a link, to current page as well 16:51  instead of showing nothing 16:51  Menso: you cannot have a link with an empty label 16:51 <@sdumitriu> The wiki syntax doesn't know XWiki internals, so it can't decide on its own "ok, this is not a proper link, let's just forget this and go home" 16:51 <@sdumitriu> You link to a document 16:51  because that's not a link anymore 16:51 <@sdumitriu> The document is always valid 16:51  there are some defaults 16:52  right, I was expecting it to be translated into 16:52 <@sdumitriu> You can't have a "not a document" document 16:52  Menso: that does not make sense 16:52  actually you might be able to force it if you put the label explicitely 16:52  because a link with only a reference and no label will have an automatically generated label, which is the name of the page it links to 16:52  so 16:53  lucaa1: see https://wiki.noiv.nl/xwiki/bin/view/GemAppTest/Haarlem everywhere it says 'Haarlem' now I want it to be empty since the value is null and only become a link if the value is not null 16:54  MySpace. 16:54  reference is resolved as a ref to current page, because that's how resolver works 16:54  and then the link label generator will generate the current page name as the label of that link 16:54  Menso: that's not correct: if you don't want links, there should be no links. having when in fact you don't want a link is against the principles of HTML 16:54  which should also be \_semantic\_ not only visual 16:55  the information is in the markup as well, not only in what the user can read 16:55  so, if you don't want links when the value is empty, you'll have to do an if 16:55  #if(myValueIsNotEmpty) 16:55   [[ ... ]] 16:55  #end 16:55  22 times :D 16:56  I'll see if I can maybe make a function in velocity to do it 16:56  yes, you can write a velocity macro 17:03  am trimis vot numai ca am vb cu tmortagne pe lista despre asta 17:04  si vbisem si cu sergiu, si ma gandeam ca na, sa zica acolo toata lumea parerea pentru posteritate 17:04  insa... 17:04  cu tmortagne pe IRC, nu pe lista 17:04  sorry guys very wrong chat 17:04  :) 17:05  (it was bound to happen) 17:05  sooner or later :) 17:09  lol, i was actually wondering just now X-D 17:09  anyway, good bye 17:09  have a nice day 17:09  has quit 17:14  has joined #xwiki 17:18  has quit 17:18  is now known as 17:19  has quit 17:25  using a velocimacro creates stuff in html output which seems to have a rather disruptive effect on my table 17:33  e.g. code in the page: 17:33  |=CMS|$doc.getValue("CMS\_Status")|#createLink("Xwiki" "SoftProd")|#createLink($doc.getValue("CMS\_Supplier") "Supplier")|$doc.getValue("CMS\_Desc") 17:34  output in HTML: 17:34  CMSgeïmplementeerdXwiki #if ($xProp == "SoftProd") 17:36  [[Software Producten.$xValue]] 17:36  #elseif ($xProp == "Supplier") 17:36  [[Leveranciers.$xValue]] 17:36  #end 17:36  #end 17:36  #end 17:36  when macro is executed, it adds a new line in the table 17:36  yes, after each link you have a newline 17:37  #if ($xValue != "") #if ($xProp == "SoftProd") [[Software Producten.$xValue]] #elseif ($xProp == "Supplier") [[Leveranciers.$xValue]] #end #end 17:37  try this 17:37  it will do the job ;) 17:37  when you have a newline, it will mean end of table line 17:37  that's why the 17:38  so much for readable code :) 17:38  but you are right, it fixed it :D 17:38  there are ways to make it more readable than that 17:38  but I took the fast way 17:39  Menso: if you want readable, you can use a filter, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Velocity+Macro 17:39  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Velocity+Macro+Filter 17:40  ah nice, thanks vmassol and lucaa1 :-) 17:40  I just need to get used to stuff like this breaking code 17:41  or rather, newlines introducing in the output 17:41  Menso: more precisely you can use the html filter and use $sp and $nl to specify spaces and newlines 17:41  {{velocity filter="html"}}.... 17:48  has quit 17:48  contains only works for lists? 17:53  are we sure we want such a page on .org ? 17:53  sburjan`: there's a mail about it on the users list 17:53  I think we sorta agreed :) 17:54  sburjan`: I see value for the community to know strenghts and weaknesses of xwiki vs other solutions 17:54  don't you think so? 17:55  fixed typo 17:56  vmassol: I agree to that, it's just that IMO competitors is a little harsh as a word to use. 17:56  yes we could replace with another word 17:57  XWiki Alternatives, etc 17:57  you can propose one 17:58  yes, Alternative is the best I can think of. Competitors leaves the impression we want to crush those products and we see them as a threat. This is how I interpret it 18:02  It might turn potential xwiki customers to your competitors or 'alternatives' 18:03  yes, also true 18:03  yes but we shouldn't be afraid of this 18:03  on the contrary 18:04  well this depends on personal perception how safe to we feel on the market 18:05  if we're bad in a domain, hiding it is not going to help, instead we'll just need to improve on that domain, and making it visible will help us address it 18:05  I think it's very important to explain the difference.. the application I'm making for NOiV now I could never have made in Confluence for example 18:06  yes good explanation is key 18:06  But if you're not interested in that, Confluence might look a lot easier to use and people might move to that instead 18:06  we want xwiki to be easier to use than confluence so we also need to know what we're lacking in this domain if that's the case 18:07  has quit 18:08  I've got XWiki and Confluence both deployed at customers, I think the big difference is in quality control atm 18:08  Menso: what do you mean ? 18:09  With new XWiki releases there's often also some new bugs in the system 18:09  A lot of the time those are quickly fixed in a new version but for the customer that means they need to upgrade to this new version again, etc 18:10  I understand 18:10  With confluence, we never have this, you turn it on and can walk out the door 18:10  Menso: one thing we're working on is to ease upgrades so at least this will mitigate the issue 18:11  Then again, with confluence, we can't build applications or customize it for customers, etc :) 18:11  note that it's much easier for confliuence 18:11  since you can't modify base pages 18:11  so there's no merge to be done 18:11  vmassol: true, confluence upgrade is extract to /usr/local/confluence ah well, it's hard to compare, they are two different tools for different purposes I suppose 18:13  indeed 18:14  also confluence is mostly for dev teams (even though it can be used by non dev teams) 18:17  vmassol: I'm proposing "Other Alternatives to XWiki" instead of competitors or rivals 18:18  sburjan`: you could propose it to gregory 18:18  or propose it on that page 18:18  or, proposing to G 18:20  sorry for missing the Thread on userlist and opening the discussion again 18:20  or on the list indeed 18:20  best place 18:22  problem is that I got until 5 minutes ago the userlist on Digest mode... so I don't see the votes. I only see the mail Gregory send and the one you replied. No +1 18:24  but I will talk to G 18:27  mflorea: ping 18:27  we'll need to talk about how you'd like to handle transformations in the wysiwyg editor 18:28  (knowing that a transformation can modify any block, and add blocks too) 18:29  so for example you might need to have a changeset id to know that several modifications come from the same transformation 18:29  well, same as with macros. I need to detect them and make the output readonly 18:29  well you also need to offer the ability to change the original text 18:30  you mean edit a transformation that isn't a macro? 18:30  for example imagine you have emoticon support 18:30  by using a drop down list of emoticons 18:30  when the user clicks on an emoticon image it outputs for ex : ) 18:30  this is transformed 18:30  but the user needs to be able to edit it to change the emoticon 18:31  (to : ( for ex) 18:31  macros or not macro, we need a generic support for all transformations I think 18:31  and special handling for well-known transformations 18:31  the difference is that macros have parameters 18:32  with the changes I' m mkaing all tx are the same 18:32  the origianl blocks are output and the HTML renderer will use the xml serialized to serailize them 18:32  in this case you needs to make the macro markers usable for all transformations 18:32  in a generic way 18:33  there are no longer macro markers 18:33  how do you mark a transformation in the HTML? 18:33  but I think we still need a transformation id 18:33  the changeset id I was referring to 18:33  vmassol: confluence mostly for dev teams? I have succes with it mostly with companies without any technical people whatsoever :-) 18:33 <+tmortagne> mflorea: you find it the same way that current macro markers 18:33 <+tmortagne> but in a more generic format 18:34  tmortagne: (07:33:06 PM) vmassol: there are no longer macro markers 18:34 <+tmortagne> that doe snot mean there is not marker 18:34 <+tmortagne> that means the markers are more generic 18:34  what do you mean by "changeset id"? 18:34 <+tmortagne> instead of macro information you find transformation informations 18:34  this changeset id is just an idea I've had (not discussed with tmortagne yet) 18:35  but I think you might need it 18:35  imagine a tx that replaces some blocks in some location and adds some others in other places in the XDOM 18:35  but why not using xml comments, just make the macro syntax more general 18:35  you'll get markers for each change 18:35  but you need to know that it's part of the same tx 18:36  sure, but that can be part of the marker syntax 18:36  s/need/might need/ 18:36 <+tmortagne> mflorea: that's the plan 18:36  yes the changeset id is going to be output in the marker syntax 18:36 <+tmortagne> again you will have a transformation marker 18:36 <+tmortagne> i dn't know about this changeset id 18:37 <+tmortagne> mflorea: for now what i see is that you will get a block marker instead of a macroblock marker basically 18:37 <+tmortagne> just a different syntax from which you can unserialize a Block 18:37  so, as long as I can detect the transformation by looking at the HTML and I have the transformation source in the HTML then I can add generic support in the wysiwyg editor 18:38 <+tmortagne> like now you unserailize a macro block basically 18:38  mflorea: it's more complex 18:38  I think 18:38  again imagine a tx that does 2 things 18:38  replace some blocks + adds some other at the end of the doc 18:39  when you double click on the added blocks 18:39  you need to find the original content 18:39  which is split 18:39 <+tmortagne> vmassol: not really 18:39  unless we repeat it for each marker 18:40 <+tmortagne> it depends of the transformation 18:41  vmassol: a transformation must have an "insertion point" i.e. the place where its source appears in the wiki syntax. This "insertion point" can be marked in the HTML and the rest of the "sub"-transformation markers must refer to this place using an id as you suggested 18:41 <+tmortagne> the important part is that the WYSIWYG can know what content is generated 18:42 <+tmortagne> then there is kind of transformations like macro it know how to handler is a specific way 18:42 <+tmortagne> but for some other it will just be readonly content 18:42 <+tmortagne> it's a case by case basis i think 18:43  tmortagne: well the user should always be able to change the original content 18:43  so when you click on "sub" marker (as mflorea calls them) you still need to be able to find the original content to edit 18:43 <+tmortagne> vmassol: you can't do that in a generic way 18:44  or each marker repeats the whole original content 18:44 <+tmortagne> every transformations are differents 18:44  sure, I'll find the marker for the insertion point and take the source from it 18:44  tmortagne: for me it's just about having a changeset id 18:44  you could use it this way in XDOM: block.startChangeset(String id), endChangeset(id) 18:45  then when you add, replace, etc it saves the "history" with the changeset id 18:45  and when we output XHTML the id is used in the markers 18:45  (haven't thought it through yet though still need some thinking) 18:46 <+tmortagne> i don't see how the WYSIWYF is supposed to do with your id 18:46 <+tmortagne> s/how/what/ 18:46  has quit 18:47  for ex,show all parts modified by the same tx in the same color, allow to edit the same original text when you click on any marker with the same changeset it 18:48  when the editor find a transformation marker it can use the id to lookup the "insertion point" and take the source of the transformation. Basically the id is useful only for editing the transformation 18:48  well, yes, for styling too 18:51  guys, I have to go 18:51  mflorea: yep me too, let's continue tomorrow 18:54  has quit 18:59  vmassol: email sent to users 18:59  reply 19:18  is there an easy way to 'clone' properties from a class, in case a user wants to set two different values to it? 19:19  for example property cms\_product should be 'joomla' and cms\_status 'phased out' while another cms\_product should be 'xwiki' and cms\_status be 'implemented' 19:25  has quit 19:26  I could use multiple select to solve issue of selecting multiple options but then the status would be unclear for each of the selected options 19:45  has joined #xwiki 19:55  guys, I want to commit XE-787 19:55  should I commit it on 2.7 as well? 19:57 <@sdumitriu> +1 19:59  sdumitriu: could you vote on the userlist regarding : [xwiki-users] [request] Comparing XWiki to other solutions 19:59 <@sdumitriu> It's not a vote 20:00  but I proposed something on that thread ... 20:00  didn't wanted to start a new thread 20:00 <@sdumitriu> K 20:03  has quit 20:04  ah wait 20:04  it's not XE 20:04  it's XAADMINISTRATIO 20:04  N 20:10  what's the diff between XE/Administration and XAADMINISTRATION ? 20:11  I have no clue...
